revealed_to_reader: THREE YEARS have passed since Book 1 ending
Contact vs Memory war has killed 8 MILLION people
Contact faction = shut down ansibles, accept alien help, prepare for Harvesters
Memory faction = ansible is humanity's sacred connection, Harvester threat is propaganda
Contact faction has military advantage, winning the war
Memory faction controls Proxima Station (47,000 people dying)
Zara Kim fully decoded Kaito's Earth data core
EARTH'S FINAL MESSAGE: Earth wanted colonies to vote on ansible's fate democratically
Earth negotiated with aliens for months, asked for safer ansible tech (not shutdown)
Aliens refused compromise, demanded full ansible shutdown
Earth chose to call for referendum rather than impose decision
Earth's final unsent transmission: 'Let humanity choose together, even if they choose death'
Contact faction has been suppressing this evidence (repeating guild's information control)
Memory faction is partially right - Contact has become new information monopoly
Commander Elise Chen chooses to release Earth's full transmission to all colonies
Immediate result: cease-fires across all systems
Admiral Webb proposes armistice and human-wide referendum
War pauses - humanity will vote on ansible's fate
74 years until Harvesters arrive (mentioned)
New POV character: Commander Elise Chen (Contact military leader)

What will Lira and Kaito find when they reach aliens?

technical_details.referendum_scope: All 47 colonies vote on single question: shut down ansible network permanently (yes/no)

themes_explored.information_control_repetition: Contact faction became what they opposed - information monopoly enforcing their truth
themes_explored.choice_vs_survival: Earth chose to let humanity vote even if it meant extinction - respecting agency over safety
themes_explored.narrative_warfare: Both factions fighting over who controls historical interpretation
themes_explored.costs_of_truth: 8 million dead from revealing guild's lies - was it worth it?
themes_explored.democracy_under_pressure: Can humanity make wise choices when facing existential threat?
themes_explored.moral_authority: Contact faction loses authority by suppressing evidence, regains it by releasing truth

mood: Grim but hopeful. War-weary. Recognition of moral complexity - no clear heroes or villains. Exhaustion from years of conflict. Cautious hope that honesty can lead to peace. Weight of casualties. Respect for Earth's sacrifice.
pacing: Fast-paced opening with battle crisis, slows for philosophical debate, accelerates during Zara's revelation, climaxes with decision to release Earth's transmission, resolves with armistice
chapter_purpose: Establish Book 2 opening status, show consequences of Book 1 truth (millions dead), introduce new POV characters, reveal Earth's final message, shift conflict from military to democratic (referendum on ansible's fate), show Contact faction must honor truth even when it hurts them

connections_to_story_graph.tentpole_type: hook - Colonial wars erupt over competing narratives about Earth
connections_to_story_graph.book_2_arc_position: Opening - establish that war isn't about simple good vs evil, both factions have valid points, introduce central question: should humanity vote on ansible fate or have survival imposed?
connections_to_story_graph.setup_for_rest_of_book: Referendum will dominate chapters 2-7, Zara's continued research, Earth's full story emerging, Lira/Kaito approaching aliens
